args:
Chapter 3 Digital FTE Strategy Restructure - Issue #386

## Feature Summary
Restructure Chapter 3 from "Billion Dollar AI" to "The Digital FTE Strategy" to align with the Agent Factory vision and eliminate redundancy with the updated Chapter 1.

## Context
- Chapter 1 has been updated with comprehensive Agent Factory content (10 lessons covering General vs Custom Agents, Digital FTE Vision, Spec-Driven Development, etc.)
- Chapter 3 currently has significant overlap with Chapter 1 content
- Agent Factory slides contain monetization content NOT yet in the book
- Issue #386 requests alignment with Digital FTE / Agent Factory strategy

## Requirements

### Structural Changes
1. Rename folder from `03-billion-dollar-ai/` to `03-digital-fte-strategy/`
2. Restructure from 8 lessons to 10 lessons
3. Add 2 NEW lessons:
   - Lesson 5: "Four Monetization Models" (from slides Part 11)
   - Lesson 8: "When NOT to Use AI Agents" (from slides Part 15)

### Lesson Updates
1. Lesson 1: Reframe from "Billion Dollar Question" to "Your Expertise as Product" - remove redundancy with Ch1, add personal application focus
2. Lesson 2: Keep "Snakes and Ladders" - minor terminology alignment
3. Lesson 3: Reframe from "Super Orchestrators" to "The FTE Advantage" - remove Digital FTE table (now in Ch1 L10), add sales presentation tips
4. Lesson 4: Significant update to "Vertical Intelligence" - add Agent Skills/SKILL.md content from slides
5. Lesson 5: NEW "Four Monetization Models" - Subscription, Success Fee, License, Marketplace
6. Lesson 6: Keep "PPP Strategy" - minor edits
7. Lesson 7: Keep "Three Requirements" (renumbered from 6)
8. Lesson 8: NEW "When NOT to Use AI Agents" - security, compliance, common pitfalls
9. Lesson 9: Update "Pause and Reflect" - new monetization-focused prompts
10. Lesson 10: Update Quiz - add 15 new questions on monetization, Agent Skills, guardrails

### Content Sources
- Agent Factory slides Part 11 (Pages 63-64): Monetization models
- Agent Factory slides Part 15 (Pages 84-87): Security, compliance, pitfalls
- Agent Factory slides Part 6 (Pages 37-50): Agent Skills/SKILL.md
- Agent Factory slides Part 12 (Pages 71-73): Digital FTE economics, sales tips

### Success Criteria
- Zero redundancy with Chapter 1 content
- All 4 monetization models clearly explained with examples
- Agent Skills/SKILL.md format documented
- "When NOT to use" guardrails included
- Quiz covers new content areas
- All .summary.md files regenerated

### Non-Goals
- Not restructuring other chapters
- Not adding code examples (conceptual chapter)
- Not changing the fundamental Snakes & Ladders or PPP frameworks

### Dependencies
- Chapter 1 Agent Factory Paradigm (completed)
- Chapter 2 AIFF Foundation (#385 - in progress, but independent)

Chapter 35: Google Agent Development Kit (ADK) - This chapter teaches building custom AI agents that are reliable, safe, and evaluated on real tasks using Google's ADK framework. The chapter builds on Chapter 34 (OpenAI SDK) to show how the same agent patterns manifest in Google's ecosystem. Key topics: ADK setup with Gemini/Vertex AI, Agent types (LlmAgent, SequentialAgent, ParallelAgent, LoopAgent), Tools (FunctionTool, AgentTool, McpToolset), Session management, Guardrails and callbacks, Evaluation with adk eval, Deployment to Vertex AI Agent Engine and Cloud Run. The running example is TaskManager Agent.

The chapter builds on Chapter 34 (OpenAI SDK) to show how the same agent patterns manifest in Google's ecosystem. Key topics: ADK setup with Gemini/Vertex AI, Agent types (LlmAgent, SequentialAgent, ParallelAgent, LoopAgent), Tools (FunctionTool, AgentTool, McpToolset), Session management, Guardrails and callbacks, Evaluation with adk eval, Deployment to Vertex AI Agent Engine and Cloud Run.
